intro: Astronidium saccatum, commonly known as the sac-like astronidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its distinctive, sac-like structures on its stems, which are thought to aid in water storage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
